response:
Urgent neuro-imaging is required to visualise the lesions and assess for dissemination in space. CSF analysis and serum autoantibodies are critical to differentiate between MS, NMOSD, and MOGAD, as this dictates long-term management. Baseline bloods are needed to exclude mimics and prepare for immunotherapy.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Whole Spine with contrast", "Anti-AQP4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Thyroid function tests", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, dsDNA)", "Serum ACE", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF microscopy, culture, glucose, protein, oligoclonal bands)", "Visual Evoked Potentials (VEP)", "Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT)"]
